instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B green light no power no chaege.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 12.57
pp3v42 - 3.460
<SIGNAL>PP18V_DCIN_CONNECTOR</SIGNAL> - 18.9
<TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR> + <TRANSISTOR>Q7630</TRANSISTOR> + <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> replaced but no go..
not turning on in SMC mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B green light no power no chaege.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B green light no power no chaege.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 11900"]<SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>? History?[/QUOTE]

no <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> present and no liquid or anything special historie to it, simply died.
<CHIP>U5010</CHIP> gives 3.294

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B green light no power no chaege.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B green light no power no chaege.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 11913"]<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> present? Short on <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>?[/QUOTE]

<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> present and yes it seems there is a short on 3v3s5

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B green light no power no chaege.
threads.message: Inject 3V and see what heats up. Shorts on 3V bus are the worst usually :(

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B green light no power no chaege.
threads.message: Ok so I injected 3v to the rail and found <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> heating up and replaced it but at first attempt I didn't noticed that the magsafe was connected and caused the green light to go off and probably some more damage, It was a minute before closing time so I didn't check where the damage could be but any ideas from your experience will be helpful.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B green light no power no chaege.
threads.message:
I lost pp3v42 so i went thorough "3.425V "G3Hot" Supply"  page 63 and it stoppes at <CHIP>U6990</CHIP> pin 9 dont exsist and seems shorted to ground, same for <CAPACITOR>C6999</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C6994</CAPACITOR> and L6995 shows nothing, I replaced all her mentioned with no luck..could use some help here, when i injected 3.4 to <CAPACITOR>C6994</CAPACITOR> <CHIP>U6990</CHIP> got the ipa off but never got realy hot.
remember that i had before pp3v42 i missed <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> and injected when magsafe on in a mistake that what caused pp3v42 to go.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B green light no power no chaege.
threads.message: So 3V42 is shorted to GND? Inject 3V and see what heats up, SMC is first suspect, PCH etc.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B green light no power no chaege.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 12006"]So 3V42 is shorted to GND? Inject 3V and see what heats up, SMC is first suspect, PCH etc.[/QUOTE]
 should i inject on <CAPACITOR>C6999</CAPACITOR> or other?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B green light no power no chaege.
threads.message: yes smc reacts immidiatly, missed that one.. to the garbage?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B green light no power no chaege.
threads.message: Well, SMC is dead at least...up to you if you want to replace and continue.
